headline: Report: Alabama cut environmental funding in half over 14 years
summary: Multiple states have significantly cut environmental agency budgets from 2010-2024, with Alabama reducing environmental spending by 49%, Texas cutting its Commission on Environmental Quality budget by one-third over the last decade, and North Carolina failing to restore recession-era cuts despite population growth; these reductions have led to fewer inspections, weaker enforcement, and longer case processing times, while the Trump administration's proposed EPA budget cuts would eliminate most grants to states, further undermining their regulatory capacity.
